description.plain:
The Original Broadway Cast of the Broadway musical The Lion King is featured on the “The Lion King (Original Broadway Cast Recording”
 (1997). They are:

Tsidii Le Loka as Rafiki
Scott Irby-Ranniar as Young Simba
Jason Raize as Adult Simba
Kajuana Shuford as Young Nala
Heather Headley as Adult Nala
John Vickery as Scar
Samuel E. Wright as Mufasa
Max Casella as Timon
Tom Alan Robbins as Pumbaa
Geoff Hoyle as Zazu
Tracy Nicole Chapman as Shenzi
Stanley Wayne Mathis as Banzai
Kevin Cahoon as Ed
Gina Breedlove as Sarabi

body.plain:
The Original Broadway Cast of the Broadway musical The Lion King is featured on the “The Lion King (Original Broadway Cast Recording”
 (1997). They are:

Tsidii Le Loka as Rafiki
Scott Irby-Ranniar as Young Simba
Jason Raize as Adult Simba
Kajuana Shuford as Young Nala
Heather Headley as Adult Nala
John Vickery as Scar
Samuel E. Wright as Mufasa
Max Casella as Timon
Tom Alan Robbins as Pumbaa
Geoff Hoyle as Zazu
Tracy Nicole Chapman as Shenzi

Kevin Cahoon as Ed

description.plain:
The idea of a “circle of life” has prevailed in almost every culture and religion.  Genesis 3:19 states “dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.”  The Perek Shirah text discusses the dignity of death and how our bodies provide life.  Native American culture represents this relationship in the symbolic “medicine wheel.”  This universal philosophy is presented by Elton John and Tim Rice in the animated movie and the musical. Circles feature throughout the musical, starting with the circular sun that rises at the beginning.

The musical immediately introduces the viewer to Julie Taymor’s unique designs, featuring tribal themes and elaborate puppetry.  In addition to the new stylistic approach, Taymor also wanted to “emphasize the women in the narrative,” which she was able to do by making Rafiki female.  The result led to a new take on the already-iconic scene, one that earned actress Tsidii Le Loka a Tony nomination.

A 360-degree filmed version of the scene from the Broadway production can be seen here. It features multiple angles from across the stage.



As the sun rises, Rafiki calls out to the animals of the Pride Lands to come to the presentation of Simba. She engages in call and response with an antelope. The first animal puppets then arrive on the stage – two giraffes and a cheetah. They are followed by an actor puppeting multiple flying birds and another  three actors puppeting three zebras. Through the aisles in the audience more animals arrive, with a rhinoceros and multiple white birds. Gazelle puppeteers arrive on the stage.

Raucous applause usually greets the largest puppet in the show, an adult female elephant puppeteered by four actors – one in each leg.



She is followed by a baby elephant and two wildebeest. Zazu appears, this time as a kite that his puppeteer spins through the air rather than the hand puppet that is used for the rest of the show.

Mufasa and Sarabi arrive with their cub Simba and ascend Pride Rock. Rafiki joins them and blesses the cub before presenting him to the animals gathered below. The animals sing and dance in joy at the sight of their new prince.

The first animal puppets then arrive on the stage – two giraffes and a cheetah. They are followed by an actor puppeting multiple flying birds and another  three actors puppeting three zebras. primary_artist.name: Original Broadway Cast of The Lion King

songs.lyrics:
[RAFIKI & ENSEMBLE]
Nants ingonyama bagithi baba
Sithi uhm ingonyama
'Ngonyama 'ngengw'ebo!

[LEBO M]
Mai ba bo, ha! Ingonyama baba!

[RAFIKI & ENSEMBLE]
Nants ingonyama bagithi baba
Sithi uhm ingonyama
'Ngonyama 'ngengw'ebo!

[FACA KULU]
Oh! Khusani bo!
Pegi Akalela! (Eshe!)

[RAFIKI & ENSEMBLE]
Nants ingonyama bagithi baba
Sithi uhm ingonyama
Ingonyama
Siyo nqoba
Ingonyama
Ingonyama nengwe 'namabala
Ingonyama nengwe 'namabala
Ingonyama nengwe 'namabala
Ingonyama nengwe 'namabala
Ingonyama nengwe 'namabala

[LEBO M & FACA KULU]
Ta-na-na-na-na
Ta-na-na-na-na-na!
Ta-na-na-na-na
Ta-na-na-na-na!
Ta-na-na-na-na
Ta-na-na-na-na-na!

[RAFIKI]
From the day we arrive on the planet
And blinking, step into the sun
There's more to see than can ever be seen
More to do than can ever be done
There is far too much to take in here
More to find than can ever be found
But the sun rolling high
Through the sapphire sky
Keeps great and small on the endless round

It's the circle of life
And it moves us all
Through despair and hope
Through faith and love
'Til we find our place
On the path unwinding
In the circle
The circle of life

[LEBO M]
Bayede! Ndebe sutha!
Khosi m'khosi! Siyabonga baba!
Bayede!
Helele helele helele!
Ukele we sizwe! Khosi wen khofu!
Siyabonga baba! Bayede!
Siyabonga baba!
Khwathu ma fikele! Khwene ndaba!
Khwathu ma fikele! Wen o wen khofu
Siyabonga baba! Bayede...

[RAFIKI & ENSEMBLE]
It's the circle of life
And it moves us all
Through despair and hope
Through faith and love
'Til we find our place
On the path unwinding
In the circle
The circle of life
